p: The E protein is the primary target for neutralizing antibody formation due to its critical role in host cell receptorâ€“mediated endocytosis and fusion. Epitopes have been mapped to all three of the E protein domains, I, II, and III: domain II near the fusion loop and the lateral ridge of domain III are both important neutralization targets ( Ansarah-Sobrinho et al., 2008, de Alwis et al., 2011, Wahala and Silva, 2011).
